alert.note: Alert for Issaquena; Sharkey (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Issaquena and southwestern Sharkey Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Onward, or 7 miles south of Rolling Fork, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Issaquena and southwestern Sharkey Counties, including the following locations... Cary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
